content: bird of a color crochet pattern by deborah ellis of neatly tangled http //neatlytangled com bird of a color any color you want her or him to be skill level easy materials worsted weight yarn of your choice including contrasting scraps for eyes feet and beak size f hook or size needed to produce a tight stuffable fabric in single_crochet polyester fiberfill or other stuffing material sufficient to stuff bird firmly abbreviations chain chain stitch double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch yo yarn over special stitches decrease insert hook through both loops of next single_crochet yo and pull through insert hook through both loops of next single_crochet yo and pull through yo and pull through all 3 loops on the hook 1 decrease counts as 1 single_crochet notes the head and body of this piece are worked in spirals do not join rounds each increasing or decreasing round features 6 repeats of the increase or decrease stitch pattern you may find it useful to mark the first stitch of each round this pattern can be worked with any weight yarn and an appropriate hook bigger yarn/hook will produce a bigger piece as written the finished bird is approximately 4 5 inches 11 5 cm tall you may want to stuff the head after completing a few rounds of the body rather than stuffing the whole piece at once this makes it easier to stuff evenly the bird of a color crochet pattern is copyright 2007 by deborah ellis please do not reproduce this pattern in whole or in part please feel free
